feed.title: Radiocarbon in the Earth System 2017
feed.subtitle: Information and resources about the short course Radiocarbon in the Earth System 2017

entry.title: Paleo environments and modeling
entry.content:
We will have lectures on paleo applications, and time to discuss practical problems with the instructors. At the end of the day, we will hand out certificates.

Day schedule

9:00-10:00, Paleo environments | John Southon

10:00-10:30, Coffee break

10:30-11:30, Compound specific radiocarbon | Valerie Schwab

11:30-12:30, Example applications | Gerd Gleixner, Brett Walker

12:30-13:30, Lunch break

13:30-14:00, Discussion problem set 3 | Carlos Sierra

15:00-15:30, Coffee break

15:30-17:00, Discussion and question time
entry.summary: We will have lectures on paleo applications, and time to discuss practical problems with the instructors. At the end of the day, we will hand out certificates.

entry.title: The ocean system
entry.content:
Brett Walker will give a lecture on the ocean. There will be a lecture on modeling radiocarbon in reservoir systems, accompanied with a practical lab.

Day schedule

9:00-10:00, The ocean system | Brett Walker

10:00-10:30, Coffee break

10:30-11:30, Modeling radiocarbon in Earth system reservoirs | Carlos Sierra

11:30-12:30, Discussion problem 2 | Susan Trumbore, Carlos Sierra

12:30-13:30, Lunch break

13:30-15:00, Modelling lab | Carlos Sierra

15:00-15:30, Coffee break

15:30-17:00, Practical lab | Axel Steinhof, Jan Muhr, Valerie Schwab, Susan Trumbore

Lectures

The lecture by Brett Walker can be found here

Modeling lab

The modeling exercise and the assignment (problem set 3), are described in the following page.

Practical lab

The assignment of groups for todayâ€™s labs is:

  • Accelerator tour lab: Green group
  • Gas and soil sampling: Blue group
  • Combustion lab: Yellow group
  • Sample preparation, HPLC and GC prep: Red group ~
entry.summary: Brett Walker will give a lecture on the ocean. There will be a lecture on modeling radiocarbon in reservoir systems, accompanied with a practical lab.

entry.title: The atmosphere system
entry.content:
Heather Graven will join us today for two lectures on atmospheric radiocarbon. We will work on problems sets and on the practical labs.

Day schedule

9:00-10:00, The atmosphere system | Heather Graven

10:00-10:30, Coffee break

10:30-11:30, Radiocarbon as fossil-fuel CO2 tracer | Heather Graven

11:30-12:30, Problem set 2 (Keeling plots, isotope mixing) | Susan Trumbore

12:30-13:30, Lunch break

13:30-15:00, Practical lab | Axel Steinhof, Jan Muhr, Valerie Schwab, Susan Trumbore

15:00-15:30, Coffee break

15:30-17:00, Practical lab | Axel Steinhof, Jan Muhr, Valerie Schwab, Susan Trumbore


Lecture slides

The slides from the two lectures from Heather Graven are below:

  • Radiocarbon in the atmosphere
  • Radiocarbon and fossil fuels


Problem set 2

Here is the description and the datasets for solving problem set 2

  • Problem set description
  • Data set on diurnal 14C in excel
  • Isoerror spreadsheet
  • Answers problem set 2


Practical labs

We have today two time blocks for the practical labs. Here is the assignment according to badge colors:

Session 1 from 13:30 to 15:00

  • Accelerator tour lab: Yellow group
  • Gas and soil sampling: Red group
  • Combustion lab: Green group
  • Sample preparation, HPLC and GC prep: Blue group

Session 2 from 15:30 to 17:00

  • Accelerator tour lab: Blue group
  • Gas and soil sampling: Yellow group
  • Combustion lab: Red group
  • Sample preparation, HPLC and GC prep: Green group
entry.summary: Heather Graven will join us today for two lectures on atmospheric radiocarbon. We will work on problems sets and on the practical labs.

entry.title: The land system
entry.content:
Claudia Czimczik will give a lecture on the terrestrial biosphere, and Axel Steinhof will talk about the AMS method. In the afternoon and in the evening students will present their own research.

Day schedule

9:00-10:00, The land system | Claudia Czimczik

10:00-10:30, Coffee break

10:30-11:30, Conventional dating | Axel Steinhof

11:30-12:30, Example applications | Jan Muhr and Marion Schrumpf

12:30-13:30, Lunch break

13:30-14:00, Discussion on problem set 1 | Susan Trumbore, Carlos Sierra

14:00-15:00, Avoiding contamination | Xiaomei Xu

15:00-15:30, Coffee break

15:30-17:00, Student presentations (5 minutes each, including questions)

18:00-19:00, Dinner at the institute

20:00-22:00, Student presentations (5 minutes each, including questions)


Lecture slides

You can obtain the slides from todayâ€™s lectures in the following links

Lecture name Instructor Link
Radiocarbon in the land system Claudia Czimczik
Tree reserves Jan Muhr
Dating Axel Steinhof
Contamination Xiaomei Xu
entry.summary: Claudia Czimczik will give a lecture on the terrestrial biosphere, and Axel Steinhof will talk about the AMS method. In the afternoon and in the evening students will present their own research.

entry.title: Radiocarbon and the global C cycle

link.title: Radiocarbon and the global C cycle

entry.content:
On the first day of the course we will learn about basic concepts of radiocarbon and earth system science, in particular the global carbon cycle, how to report radicarbon measurements, how to date organic material, and applications for tree-ring research.

Day schedule

9:00-10:00, Radiocarbon in ecology and Earth system science | Susan Trumbore

10:00-10:30, Coffee break

10:30-11:30, Radiocarbon nomenclature | Xiaomei Xu

11:30-12:30, Accelerator Mass Spectrometry of Radiocarbon | Axel Steinhof

12:30-13:30, Lunch break

13:30-14:00, Problem set 1 | Susan Trumbore

14:00-15:00, Tree rings and radiocarbon | Lukas Wacker

15:00-15:30, Coffee break

15:30-17:00, Practical lab | Axel Steinhof, Jan Muhr, Valerie Schwab, Susan Trumbore


Lectures

You can find all lectures from the day in the links below

Lecture name Instructor Download link
Radiocarbon in ecology and Earth system science Susan Trumbore
Radiocarbon nomenclature Xiaomei Xu
Acceleretor Mass Spectrometry Axel Steinhoff
Tree rings Lukas Wacker


Lab groups

Hereâ€™s the assignment of the lab groups:

  • Accelerator tour lab: Red group
  • Gas and soil sampling: Green group
  • Combustion lab: Blue group
  • Sample preparation, HPLC and GC prep: Yellow group


Problem set 1

Now you can test what you learn on monday lectures. We prepared a problem set for you to solve. The problem and additional data to work on the solution are in the files below:

  • Problem set 1 description

  • Tree data in excel , and in csv .

  • Answers to problem set 1:
entry.summary: On the first day of the course we will learn about basic concepts of radiocarbon and earth system science, in particular the global carbon cycle, how to report radicarbon measurements, how to date organic material, and applications for tree-ring research.

entry.title: Get together
entry.content:
We will start the course with an informal meeting to get to know each other better. We will meet at
18:00 in Daheme, Johannisplatz 15 â€“ 07743 Jena.

Please be aware that we cannot cover the expenses for this voluntary meeting. Everybody will be responsible for their own consumption, however Daheme is a very affordable restaurant.

For directions, follow the map:
